explanation: Crafts and sends a Wake-on-LAN magic packet (6x FF followed by the MAC 16 times) via broadcast to wake a sleeping host, enabling it to accept subsequent connections. Requires root for raw packet send; typically performed via sudo if not already root. Detection: monitor for WOL frames (UDP/9 or UDP/7 with 0xFF*6 + MAC*16) especially outside business hours.
rationale_steps: Construct exact WoL payload: 6 bytes FF then 16x target MAC.
Send as L2/L3 broadcast to reach sleeping NICs.
Target wakes, enabling remote access workflows.
Root is required to craft and transmit raw Ethernet frames.
Detection: packet inspection for WoL signature; alert on anomalous broadcast storms or off-hours WoL events.
